intro: Leucostele chiloensis, commonly known as the Chilean leucostele, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Chile. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, hollow stems. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or rocky soils. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in umbels, and it produces seeds that are dispersed by wind. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
